org.jdesktop.core.animation.timing
Interface TimingTarget

All Known Implementing Classes:
TimingTargetAdapter
public interface TimingTarget

This interface provides the methods which are called by an animation during the course of a timing sequence. Applications that wish to receive timing events will either create a subclass of TimingTargetAdapter and override methods of interest or they can create or use an implementation of TimingTarget. A timing target can be passed into an Animator.Builder via the Animator.Builder#addTarget(TimingTarget) method or set later with the Animator.addTarget(TimingTarget) method. Any animation may have multiple timing targets.

The thread context of calls to all the methods defined below is that of the of the timing source being used by the animation. This thread context is typically documented for each TimingSource subclass.

Author:
Chet Haase, Tim Halloran

 void begin(Animator source)
          Called once when the animation begins.

Method Detail

begin

void begin(Animator source)
Called once when the animation begins. This provides a chance for targets to perform any setup required at animation start time.

This is always the first call made to any timing target.

Parameters:
source - the animation.

end

void end(Animator source)
Called once when the animation ends.

This is always the last call made to any timing target.

Parameters:
source - the animation.

cancel

void cancel(Animator source)

repeat

void repeat(Animator source)
Called when the animation repeats the animation cycle. This method will be invoked Animator.getRepeatCount() - 1 times, unless Animator.getRepeatCount() == Animator.INFINITE in which case it will be invoked until the animation is manually stopped.

Parameters:
source - the animation.

reverse

void reverse(Animator source)
Called when a running animation is reversed via Animator.reverseNow(). This method is not invoked when Animator.startReverse() is called—it is only used as a notification when a running animation is reversed.

Parameters:
source - the animation.

timingEvent

void timingEvent(Animator source,
                 double fraction)
This method will receive all of the timing events during an animation. The fraction is the percent elapsed (0 to 1) of the current animation cycle.

Parameters:
source - the animation.
fraction - the fraction of completion between the start and end of the current cycle. Note that on reversing cycles ( Animator.Direction.BACKWARD) the fraction decreases from 1.0 to 0 on backwards-running cycles. Note also that animations with a duration of INFINITE will have an undefined value for the fraction, since there is no fraction that makes sense if the animation has no defined length.
